com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess
Class Filter

java.lang.Object
  com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.Filter

public final class Filter
extends Object

Representation of a conditional processing profile (contents of a .ditaval file).

Specifies the console on which messages issued during filtering are to be displayed. Invoked by the PreProcessor.

Parameters:
c - the console; may be null, in which case messages are displayed on System.err and System.out

filterMap

filterTopic

public void filterTopic(LoadedTopic loadedTopic)
Apply this filter to specified topic.

Depending on the contents of specified topic, this may cause one of the following side-effects on the topic and/or its descendant elements:

  • Mark the topic as excluded using LoadedTopic.setExcluded(true).
  • Flag the topic element by specifying a Filter.Flags object as the value of the FLAGS_KEY application-level attribute (W3C DOM method Node.setUserData() is used to add this application-level attribute to the topic element).
  • Delete the descendant element.
  • Wrap the descendant element into a ditac:flags element having the proper style attributes.

Notes:

  • Assumes that all filter attributes have been properly cascaded.
  • Filtering and flagging is performed using only the following attributes: @audience, @platform, @product, @otherprops, @props, specializations of @props and @rev.
  • @otherprops is assumed to contain simple, non-structured, strings. (This is not required by the DITA 1.2 spec.)
  • Nested topics are not processed.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Simple test driver.
